Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler's defending champions aim to become the first team to retain the trophy.
Australia has won the 2021 edition and are current world title-holders in Test and ODI cricket.
England's recent performance has been affected by rain, leading to a share of the points in their opener against Scotland.
England needs a win to avoid further questions regarding their ODI World Cup defense.
Australia's head-to-head record against England in T20 is less impressive, with England having won six of the last seven completed encounters.
Glenn Maxwell has been on a poor run, scoring 115 at an average of 8.21 in 14 T20 innings.
Jos Buttler has faced increasing scrutiny after England's early exit at the 50-over World Cup.
Pat Cummins is set to return after being rested for the Oman game.
England may consider Reece Topley coming in for Mark Wood.
The match will be played on a new surface at Kensington Oval, which has produced markedly different results for batting.
England has a slight edge in the overall T20I head-to-head with Australia, winning 11 and losing 10.
There have only ever been two 200-plus scores in 25 completed T20Is at Kensington Oval, both in the same match between England and West Indies in 2022.
